data.title: Question: Running OpenRA on webserver frontend UI?
data.body:
Hey thanks for this awsome project! The title is a little vague I know...
What i want to accomplish is to visit a WAN or LAN address and be able to play OpenRA in the browser.

Hosted on a powerfull machine, anyone know if this is possible? It would be like a dedicated server and a frontend...

Thanks

data.title: feature request: resourcemultipler trait
data.body:
As the title, just asking that this be added in, as certain buildings in RA2, namely the ore purifier, use it.
This would give modders more ways to play with the resource system without having to add coding.

data.title: Spies keep their disguise from a dead player
data.body: spies should lose their disguise when disguise-associated player surrenders or dies ... but probably keep the disguise when disguise-associated player only disconnects

data.title: Make Armament as overridable as possible
data.body: To allow downstream mods to ship customised `Armament` derivatives without breaking backwards-compatibility with `Common`.

data.title: Fix building/training spam
data.body:
Hello OpenRA community.

One thing that is really kind of annoying in OpenRA, is that everything you click on a building to be built  or a vehicle/infantry to be made, it will spam building over and over again (or training for infantry). There is a similar pull request to mine for unit commands, but I also wish for this to be fixed, as well.

Here is the pull request: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/11781

data.title: AI cannot find deploy location for its backup MCV
data.body: I've just seen this while testing a PR. Several AI lost their conyards, built MCVs, but then didn't do anything with them. Some quick debug statements showed that `ChooseBuildLocation()` returns null in `FindAndDeployBackupMcv()`. Haven't had time to dig further yet.

data.title: Update .NET
data.body:
While it doesn't have to be in the next release or anything, but maybe update .NET to 4.5.2? This version can still run on Vista and up as well as Visual Studio 2013, so no system requirements are changed.

Alternatively, you can update to 4.6, which will still run on Vista, however, I do not know if it can run with Visual Studio 2013

Sorry if this was already discussed, but I didn't see this being talked about anywhere.

data.title: Fix for System Overflow exception
data.body: caused by casting a greater than int.MaxValue decimal to int. Fix limits offset to int.MaxValue respectively int.MinValue.

data.title: Cancel production by type
data.body:
Currently, you can cancel a unit production line with Ctrl-Click.

I suggest the idea of cancelling a whole type production line, by Ctrl-clicking on the type icon. 
For instance : cancel all the infantry.

This could help in the situation where different units are queued up, but then suddenly there is a need to switch to a particular unit production, and cancel all the current queues. 
For instance : cancel all the infantry, to focus on riflemen production, to repel an enemy infantry blob.

data.title: Fix UpgradeOnDamage to apply if initial DamageState is valid

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
As pointed out by Nolt on IRC, on bleed upgrades don't work even if the initial `DamageState` is valid, until the actor's damage state changes.
However, modders might want to use the trait to apply upgrades while the actor is undamaged, and there might be maps with actors starting at valid damage states, too.

This PR makes the trait perform an additional check for a valid `DamageState` at creation.

data.title: Unit order viewer (WIP)
data.body:
This is a UI widget that allows units to issue special orders, traits are going to have to add those orders to the ResolveOrders method for it to do anything.

Todo list:
- [x] Trait that describes an Order with ui info
- [x] Widget that looks for OrderProvider traits and displays them.
- [ ] Finalize the Chrome
  - [ ] RA
  - [ ] CnC
  - [ ] D2K
  - [ ] TS
- [ ] Make Icons for all the orders
- [ ] Allow Mouse interaction
- [x] Allow Hotkey interaction
- [ ] Display Order interaction
- [ ] Change IOrderTargeters and Traits to fully support UIOrders.
- [ ] Add Order definitions to yaml where needed
- [ ] Show tooltip in the Order UI with name and description of what the order does and hotkey.
- [ ] Add support for instant orders that take effect as soon as you hit the button in the ui.

data.title: Ensure HackyAI tries to attack and capture as frequently as it should.
data.body:
Returning early in AssignRolesToIdleUnits would skip ticking down the counters that trigger new attack and capture attempts. This means they would be attempted far less often than intended.

Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/11417#discussion_r72907137.

data.title: Improve support for features needed by external mods
data.body:
In the past, certain features and changes were submitted which were needed for 3rd-party mods, but not really necessary for any of the shipping/WIP 1st-party mods, sometimes leading to discussions over whether to accept them or not (due to regression concerns or lack of usefulness for the shipping mods), in some cases leading to their rejection.

While understandable, one of the results has been that currently, a couple of modders - myself included - ship their own modified versions of `Common` traits or activities and effects, and/or rarely submit new features or changes upstream because the reviewing process, upgrade rules, solving of regression concerns and overall code 'perfection' required to get those changes accepted into bleed - in some cases in addition to their lack of value for the official mods - is simply way too time-consuming compared to simply shipping them in their own dll.

This approach sort of works, but it also means that a lot of features and changes that could be useful for more than just 1 or 2 modders never get submitted to upstream.
Additionally, there are cases (in my mods, at least) where even a 3rd-party dll currently doesn't help implementing a wanted feature, because that feature would require direct modifications to `Common` code (because certain pieces of `Common` code currently aren't overridable) and sometimes complex upgrade rules as well, blocking features even in external mods.

A possible solution to improve the situation could look like this:
1. As far as possible, make `Common` features that 3rd-party mods might want to modify overridable if they aren't already, so direct modifications of `Common` become unnecessary most of the time
2. Introduce an additional `Unsupported` mod dll to OpenRA, where features not needed by TS and the shipping mods, but potentially useful for several external mods, can be added more easily

This new `Unsupported` dll would not be used by any of the official mods, with 'unsupported' meaning
- features or default values can be changed, renamed or removed without repercussions or the need for upgrade rules if there's a solid reason (modders that use any of these features should be aware of its 'beta' and DIY nature)
- generally more lenience when accepting new features to this dll (still requiring +2, adherance to StyleCop and no unresolved issues if possible, but not requiring upgrade rules or completely hack-free code)
- could also be used as proving ground for features deemed potentially useful to the shipping mods, but too risky to accept into `Common` as-is
- if a feature has been tested enough and is considered useful and 'safe', it could be moved down to `Common` later

Ultimately, the idea is to 
- lower the hurdle for less experienced external contributors to get their features merged
- increase the pace and probability of new features being merged in general
- increase sharing of work and ideas between makers of external mods, reducing the _"everyone cooking their own soup"_ effect
- avoid regressions in the first-party mods without rejecting/blocking features for or in external mods

data.title: Fix CanBeViewedByPlayer query in HackyAI.GetVisibleActorsBelongingToPlayer
data.body: I was checking the wrong player's visibility status.

data.title: OSX player colors incorrect in map and textual countdown timers
data.body: The OSX version has issues with player colors. I haven't thoroughly investigated it but if I remember correctly enemies always appear red, local player always appears green, and allies always appear yellow. Same goes for countdown text for a-bombs, GPS launches, etc.
